content.description: sit start under the roof and go straight up
content.location: Far far right end of Balcony Jr. cliffline. There is a squat overhang in the hillside.

content.description: Left of Cold Steel Corner in the smooth face.
By the tree
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: The middle of three sport routes on this end of the wall. The routes tend to trend left as they move upward due to the lean of the wall.
content.protection: Long TR setup. Watch falling debris
content.location: This route starts at the right side of the low cave

content.description: Sit start 2 feet right of Bat Crack, use small crimps to climb up
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: Start low on the left blunt arete. Climb up with help from holds on left face and arete to top out on slopey top.
content.location: left side of short overhang

content.description: Sustained climbing from the ledge to the top and the wall is steeper than it looks. If you fall low, odds of you getting back on at the fall point are low. You'll have to re-climb up to it.
Watch for falling debris if people above cliff. Steep slope sheds debris easily
sit start, right of 7 Second Peel
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: To the left of the start to Potomac Power Plant Pump or 4P, is an unprotected variation start. It begins on the lip of the low cave on directional jugs. Set up a top rope on 4P to do this start.
content.protection: Long TR setup. Watch falling debris
content.location: Middle of the low cave

content.description: Begin below a ledge just left of Groovin' Up Slowly. Climb up and pass the first roof on the left. Continue up, staying right of The Founder's Forge, weaving around or climbing through bulges as they come, finishing right toward Groving Up Slowly (shared anchors). (Indy)
content.location: Right side of cliff.

content.description: Begin below a ledge just left of Groovin' Up Slowly. Climb up and pass the first roof on the left. Continue up, staying right of The Founder's Forge, weaving around or climbing through bulges as they come, until you reach a ledge. Step left and finish on The Founder's Forge. This version shares anchors with The Founder's Forge, not Groovin' Up Slowly

Begin at the start of 4P Super Pump and link into Paymaster by climbing up and leftward. This route is usually done as a top-rope climb but could be lead if the rope was pre-clipped into an anchor on Paymaster.
content.protection: Long TR setup. Watch falling debris
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: Scary to lead! But if you're on top rope, you'll be able to enjoy the interesting cruxes and the otherwise not as good as you'd hope horizontals.
content.protection: Toprope or Trad   There is 1 bolt on the route that was installed for Salty Dog Saloon but you will need to find placements along the rest of the route if you decide to lead this one. Gear sizes are not known at this time.
content.location: On the slightly overhanging face to the right of the large Cold Steel Corner left facing dihedral. This begins the same as Salty Dog Saloon and then trends left. You can use the top anchors of Cold Steel Corner to lower.

content.description: Climb the blunt arete to anchors.
content.protection: SS ring top anchors available. Most people top rope this route though it is also a great lead on trad. It takes great gear but is not an ideal lead for a new trad leader. The top is the hardest part for the climbing AND gear placement so best to enjoy this after you are a bit more seasoned as a trade gear leader.
content.location: Right most route on the cliff.

content.description: Begin 15' left of Cold Steel Corner.
Start 5' left of Mojo Filter at the left end of the ledge thigh high off the ground. Follow up the white-streaked shallow groove to a white knob at the top.
This is a link-up between B&O Burn and Founders Forge. Begin on B&O and climb straight up and a bit to the right to finish on Founders Forge.
content.protection: TR anchors, or sport on the bottom and trad on the top (mixed).
content.location: see beta photo

content.description: This route climbs up to the beautiful orange streak and through the roof. It is dirty on the upper headwall with lichen. Not many people who visit the cliff do this route. With increased traffic it would clean up.
content.protection: Long runners for setting up a top rope anchor
content.location: See topo image

content.description: sit start on a pretty slopey rail and go straight up.
content.location: Far far right end of Balcony Jr. cliffline. There is a squat overhang in the hillside. Damn Leaves is further into the overhang than Valley of Fear.

content.description: This route begins on the left side of the cave.
content.protection: Long TR setup. Watch falling debris
content.location: Left side of the cave

content.description: easy ramp down low to short somewhat slippery corner up high. Watch for falling debris if people above cliff. Steep slope sheds debris easily
content.location: Large left facing dihedral on upper half of the route. Left of the middle of the cliff.

content.description: Sit start, far left end of sunshine wall
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: Sit start the same as Bright Lights and climb into Bat Crack
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: crack/seam
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: Begin 10' left of The Founder's Forge. Bold initial moves gain the rounded rock above. Climb over/around/between/through bulges, overhangs, and grooves. Don't burn out before you hit the top! (Indy)   If I remember correctly, this route is awkward if you climb to the right of bolt (number 2 or 3, approx 20 feet up) at a bulge low on the route. If you climb left and then up it flows very nicely the entire way.
content.protection: Long TR setup. Watch falling debris
content.location: Right of the low cave.

content.description: This route follows the left leaning crack, that starts at the left side of the cave on the right side of the cliff, halfway up the cliff to a right traversing seam/horizontal created by a weaker rock unit. At that point it moves right along the horizontal seam to finish at the top of The Paymaster.  Gear is good in the bottom section. Along the right traverse portion it is not as good and sometimes the rock has some lichen or is damp or slightly dirty due to the water and plant growth. Be solid at the grade because the crux is during the traverse where the gear isn't as easy. The route is listed as 60 feet because is zags.
content.protection: Preview the route on TR. My recollection is a regular set of cams but memory can fail.
content.location: Left side of the cave.

content.description: Sit start at the flake
content.location: SUNSHINE WALL (bottom left side of Balcony Jr cliff)

content.description: Balcony Jr. is a wall along a power line clearing
